title: Predicting COO for RNASeq data
text: vignette details concise example running COO classifier new RNASeq dataset. example run Rescomp3 HPC cluster Genentech, uses raw data output Genentech sequencing pipeline.

title: Predicting COO for RNASeq data
text: COO classifier requires supply raw count matrix, supplied Genentech’s RNASeq processing pipeline. prediction model fit using “stranded count” data, best performance recommend use dataset. Theoretically program may work unstranded counts, data normalized different way, can’t guarantee consistent results. can classify samples, convert data DESeqDataSet. SummarizedExperiments, simple: Alternatively, data formatted matrix, use following command: Note order classifier work, necessary row names CDS correct format. classifier expects row names “Gene IDs”, e.g. “GeneID:9294”, genes used model must present dataset. standard model, 21 genes, following IDs:
code: library(DESeq2) cds = DESeqDataSet(strandedCtSummary,design=~1) ## counts is a matrix, with rows of features and columns of samples. cds = DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(counts,   colData=data.frame(ID=colnames(counts)),   rowData=data.frame(ID=rownames(counts)),   design=~1) ##  [1] "`GeneID:10538`"  "`GeneID:10672`"  "`GeneID:11040`"  "`GeneID:152137`" ##  [5] "`GeneID:23139`"  "`GeneID:23495`"  "`GeneID:26278`"  "`GeneID:3055`"   ##  [9] "`GeneID:327657`" "`GeneID:3662`"   "`GeneID:3707`"   "`GeneID:4311`"   ## [13] "`GeneID:4603`"   "`GeneID:51700`"  "`GeneID:54836`"  "`GeneID:55534`"  ## [17] "`GeneID:64764`"  "`GeneID:6597`"   "`GeneID:79754`"  "`GeneID:8994`"   ## [21] "`GeneID:9294`"

title: Predicting COO for RNASeq data
text: COO classifier can applied cds object using single command, coo_rnaseq(). example : returned object consists three columns: - Sample IDs, drawn column names cds object. - LPS - Linear Predictor Score, used split samples GCB ABC, - COO - Cell Origin classification; either GCB, ABC, Unclassified

title: Predicting COO for RNASeq data
text: classifier actually consists two steps, can run individually. example :

title: Predicting COO for RNASeq data
text: default, uses built-“coo_GOYA_21gene” classifier, developed GOYA dataset. However, option supplying version classifier (example, genes available, gene model changes).

title: Predicting COO for RNASeq data
text: DZsig classifier can applied cds object: Thresholds DZsig classification published NanoString DLBCL90 assay (Ennishi et al., J Clin Oncol 2019; Data Supplement). also possible obtain DZsig COO calls generate combined “refined COO” classification: returned object last function six columns: Sample IDs, drawn column names cds object. LPS_COO - linear predictor score COO classification COO - Cell Origin classification; either GCB, ABC, Unclassified LPS_DZsig - linear predictor score DZsig classification DZsig - Dark Zone signature classification; either DZsig-POS, DZsig-IND, DZsig-NEG ABC, ABC DZsig-POS, DZsig-POS Else, COO (GCB Unclassified) details, please refer documentation package.

what: An RNASeq-based Cell of Origin classifier
title: An RNASeq-based Cell of Origin classifier
text: package contains code applying Cell Origin classifier RNASeq data. process consists three steps: parallel process exists performing Dark Zone signature (DZsig) classification.
code: 1) normalizing 2) calculating the LPS score 3) splitting samples into GCB/ABC based on fixed cut-points.

title: An RNASeq-based Cell of Origin classifier
An RNASeq-based Cell of Origin classifier
text: input gneSeqCOO method raw count matrix, formatted DESeqDataSet. standard count matrix, can generated via code : Note order classifier work, necessary row names CDS correct format. classifier currently accepts Refseq “Gene IDs” (formatted “GeneID:9294”) Ensembl IDs (ENSG….). Genes dataset filtered running algorithm, complete genome used normalize individual samples. COO classifier can applied cds object using single command, coo_rnaseq(). example : returned object consists three columns: Sample IDs, drawn column names cds object. LPS - Linear Predictor Score, used split samples GCB ABC, COO - Cell Origin classification; either GCB, ABC, Unclassified also possible obtain DZsig COO calls generate combined “refined COO” classification: returned object last function six columns: Sample IDs, drawn column names cds object. LPS_COO - linear predictor score COO classification COO - Cell Origin classification; either GCB, ABC, Unclassified LPS_DZsig - linear predictor score DZsig classification DZsig - Dark Zone signature classification; either DZsig-POS, DZsig-IND, DZsig-NEG ABC, ABC DZsig-POS, DZsig-POS Else, COO (GCB Unclassified) details, please refer documentation package.
code: ## counts is a matrix, with rows of features and columns of samples. cds = DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(counts,   colData=data.frame(ID=colnames(counts)),   rowData=data.frame(ID=rownames(counts)),   design=~1) coo_pred = coo_rnaseq(cds) refined_pred = refined_coo_rnaseq(cds)

title: Primary COO classifier — coo_GOYA_21gene
text: 'lm' object containing 21 gene COO classifier, developed GOYA dataset. Two versions available, data processed either IGIS3.0 IGIS4.0

title: Primary COO classifier — coo_GOYA_21gene
text: object class 'lm'. Coefficients can viewed accessing '$coefficients' slot. object class lm length 7.

title: Primary COO classifier — coo_GOYA_21gene
text: Refer COO_Classifier.html file inst/reports details development model.

title: COO Normalization function — coo_normalize
text: standard normalization function RNASeq data

title: COO Normalization function — coo_normalize
text: cds DESeqDataSet object, raw counts "counts" slot.

title: COO Normalization function — coo_normalize
text: normalized DESeqDataSet

title: COO Normalization function — coo_normalize
text: function applies robust library size normalization procedure raw count matrix provided. goal specifically ensure expression values data consistent scale, regardless source dataset. details robust library size normalization function, refer "COO_Classifier" supplemental vignette. Please note rownames raw count matrix must either refseq IDs ENSEMBL gene IDs. Gene symbols work. Notably, purposes machine learning, care absolute expression genes, expression relative samples. , combined fact people may know get read lengths easily new data means skipping normalization step involving read length.

title: COO prediction function — coo_predict
text: Function predicting COO using normalized RNASeq dataset

title: COO prediction function — coo_predict
text: norm_eset normalized ExpressionSet, returned coo_normalize model fitted COO model.

title: COO prediction function — coo_predict
text: data frame three columns: Sample names LPS score prediction COO class

title: COO prediction function — coo_predict
text: function uses model generated GOYA dataset predict Cell Origin normalized expression dataset. subsetting needs performed, expression matrix must either refseq (e.g. "geneID:7900") ENSEMBL (e.g. ENSG....) gene IDs rownames

title: Combined COO function — coo_rnaseq
text: wrapper running coo_normalize coo_predict together

title: Combined COO function — coo_rnaseq
text: cds DESeqDataSet object, raw counts "counts" slot.

title: Combined COO function — coo_rnaseq
text: data frame COO predictions. See coo_predict details

title: Combined COO function — coo_rnaseq
text: function wrapper two core COO prediction functions. function intentionally forces standard procedure normalization modeling, give us best chance model matching training data.

title: Primary DZsig classifier — dzsig_GAMBL_29gene
text: 'lm' object containing 29 gene DZsig classifier, developed GAMBL DLBCL dataset. Two versions available, data processed either IGIS3.0 (RefSeq IDs) IGIS4.0 (Ensembl IDs).

title: Primary DZsig classifier — dzsig_GAMBL_29gene
text: object class 'lm'. Coefficients can viewed accessing '$coefficients' slot. object class lm length 12.

title: DZsig prediction function — dzsig_predict
text: Function predicting DZsig using normalized RNASeq dataset

title: DZsig prediction function — dzsig_predict
text: norm_eset normalized ExpressionSet, returned coo_normalize model fitted DZsig model.

title: DZsig prediction function — dzsig_predict
text: data frame three columns: Sample names LPS score prediction DZsig class

title: DZsig prediction function — dzsig_predict
text: function uses model generated GAMBL dataset predict Dark Zone Signature (DZsig) normalized expression dataset. subsetting needs performed, expression matrix must either refseq (e.g. "geneID:7900") ENSEMBL (e.g. ENSG....) gene IDs rownames. Thresholds used classification -15.6 -6.3, per original DLBCL90 publication (Ennishi et al, J Clin Oncol 2019).

title: Combined DZsig function — dzsig_rnaseq
text: wrapper running coo_normalize dzsig_predict together

title: Combined DZsig function — dzsig_rnaseq
text: cds DESeqDataSet object, raw counts "counts" slot.

title: Combined DZsig function — dzsig_rnaseq
text: data frame DZsig predictions. See dzsig_predict details

title: Combined DZsig function — dzsig_rnaseq
text: function wrapper core normalization prediction functions.

title: Refined COO prediction function — refined_coo_rnaseq
text: function wrapper runs normalization COO DZsig predictions, combines results single data frame, including refined COO class. Refined Cell Origin classification assigned hierarchically: ABC, ABC DZsig-POS, DZsig-POS Else, COO (GCB Unclassified)
